meaning_str.bing:
n. 语言；言语；说话；某种类型的言语（或语言）
网络. 语言设定；语文；语种

语言；言语；说话；某种类型的言语（或语言）

语言；言语；语言文字；语言风格；措辞；说话方式；表达方式；交际方式；行话；术语；专业用语

1.en: Qatari-owned Al Jazeera is the best known of the racier channels, but it is only one of a dozen 24-hour Arabic-language news providers.
1.cn: 卡塔尔国营的半岛电视台就是最为出名的种族主义频道，但是它只是众多24小时阿拉伯语新闻提供者之一。

2.en: But between them there are differences in program language, as well as in concept of developing and view in developing.
2.cn: 但这两种方法不仅表现为程序语言上的差异，还表现在开发思想和开发视角上的差异。

3.en: However, Galileo did not care that he had found that "science is the mathematical nature of the language. "
3.cn: 可是伽利略并不理会，他已经发现“数理科学是大自然的语言”。

0.en: But how did you learn our language?
0.cn: 那你怎么会说我们的语言？

1.en: There are two main problems linguists face when constructing these language family trees.
1.cn: 语言学家们在重建这些语言系谱时主要面临两大问题。

2.en: Did you ever study a second language in high school or college?
2.cn: 你有在高中或大学时学过第二语言吗？

3.en: And your brain is designed to learn a language through conversation.
3.cn: 你的大脑天生就是要用对话学习语言。

4.en: But I think it's a lot easier to say than the English-speaking language, or Asian-speaking language, Chinese, or getting into specifics.
4.cn: 如果说英语地区，亚洲语言地区，华语地区就更明确了。

5.en: And when you speak your truth, can you use simple and clear language?
5.cn: 讲到自己的真相时，也应使用简单明了的语言。

6.en: Have you a name? You understand our language. Again, have you a name?
6.cn: 你有名字吗？你能听懂我们的语言，再问你一次，你有名字吗？

7.en: I'm going to share with you the biggest insight in the language learning that was discovered almost 50 years ago by doctor Paul Pimsleur, someone you could call the Einstein of learning language.
7.cn: 我要和大家分享一个50年前发现的关于语言学习的重要观察，这是由Paul Pimsleur博士发现的，他堪称是语言学习方面的爱因斯坦。

8.en: Started out, Jarvis was just a natural language UI, now he runs an Iron Legion.
8.cn: 一开始，贾维斯只是个自然语言界面，现在他掌管钢铁军团。

9.en: Here. What language is this? I don't know. But look, this is Mother's handwriting.
9.cn: 在这，这是什么语言？我不知道，不过，这是母亲的笔迹。

10.en: These are words. What language is it? Must be fairy. I can read. I can read it.
10.cn: 这些文字。这是什么语言？一定是精灵语。我会读。我认得这些。

11.en: The language we use is it's a place where the curvature of space and time gets infinitely high.
11.cn: 我们使用的语言，就是这个地方的时空弯曲得无限高。

12.en: You don't seem to be understanding the English word "no." Maybe a different language will help.
12.cn: 你好像不太懂英语的“NO”，或者换其他语言比较好。

13.en: We don't really know if such an original language ever existed, but we do know that the thousands of languages existing today can be traced back to a much smaller number.
13.cn: 我们不知道是否曾经存在过这么一种初始语言，但我们知道如今的成千上万种语言可以追溯到有限的几种。

14.en: We may never be able to determine how language came about, or whether all human languages did in fact have a common ancestor scattered through the babel of migration.
14.cn: 我们也许永远不会知道语言从何而来，也不知道人类语言是否真有共同的原始母语并通过移民们散落于各处。

15.en: Couple things, actually. Your tone of voice, your body language... Get out. Well, now, that.
15.cn: 实际上好有几个，你的说话语气，身体语言... 给我出去。瞧，还有这个。

16.en: Of the many gifts England has given to the world, none has been greater than her language and literature.
16.cn: 英格兰为世界带来了很大的贡献，但最深远的莫过于它的语言和文学。

17.en: Writers, have you challenged the language and imagery you used to portray women in the media?
17.cn: 作家们，你们是否曾经质疑过你们曾经在媒介之中描绘女性所使用的语言和意象？

18.en: So I ask you to ask each other for the truth and other people: can you list it in simple and clear language?
18.cn: 我希望你们在向他人询问真相的时候，能用简单明了的语言相互交流。

19.en: His whole approach to language learning can be summed up by the statements: when you know what sounds right, everything else is easy.
19.cn: 他的语言学习方法简而言之就是 “听对了，其他就简单了。”
